root.name: Chase H.Q. II
root.description: TriviaThe Amstrad version of the game is extremely rare in the United Kingdom.Some English PAL regions received a release of this title under the Japanese name (Super H.Q). These cartridges were made using the first generation Mega Drive casing which made them incompatible with the model 2 Megadrive/Genesis. As a result model 2 owners required the use of an Action Replay or Game Genie to play this title.Critical ReceptionElectronic Gaming Monthly's Mike Weigand gave the game a score of 8 out of 10. He wrote, "...a nice twist to the usual behind-the-car perspective of so many racing games: you get to bash the criminals to a halt!"
